Brush and Floss Regularly: Without dentists, the only way to maintain dental hygiene would be through regular brushing and flossing. It is important to brush twice a day, floss daily, and use mouthwash to keep your teeth healthy and clean.

Use Over-the-Counter Products: Over-the-counter products such as toothpaste, toothbrushes, and dental floss can help keep your teeth clean and healthy. However, it is important to choose products that are appropriate for your specific dental needs.

DIY Dental Care: There are many DIY dental care methods that can be done at home, such as using baking soda and water to clean your teeth or using a straw to help with teeth alignment. However, it is important to research and test these methods before using them regularly.
Visit a Dental Hygienist: While dentists may not be available, dental hygienists can still provide regular cleanings and check-ups to help maintain dental health.

Eat a Healthy Diet: Eating a healthy diet that is rich in fruits, vegetables, and dairy products can help promote good dental health. It is also important to limit sugary and acidic foods, which can cause tooth decay.
